page.title: 10LOCAL INHABITANTS
page.content: In the past,the families of local inhabitants would have lived here for generations,but now the ratio of "natives" to "comers_in" is about 50:50.The attraction of beautiful scenery,individual houses,peace & lower rates have drawn people from the town to the country.With the advent of mechanisation,farms employed fewer men,cottages became empty & were quickly bought & modernised by "townies".Many locals now have jobs in or near Sheffield & also keep a few animals to supplement their income. They enjoy living in the country & are glad to return after a day at work. They dislike the traffic & noise of the city.Very few want any changes to their area except perhaps to have mains drains!
